property.name: text
property.value: Desired temperature, in Celsius, for daytime and nighttime.

property.name: text
property.value:
This model implements the ptolemy-room demo from BCVTB by Michael Wetter as a web service.
Please run the model, then point your browser to http://localhost:8080

property.name: text
property.value: Authors: Beth Latronico, Michael Wetter (ptolemy-room demo)

property.name: text
property.value: stopQueueWhenEmpty must be unchecked in DE director

property.name: text
property.value: A type must be specified for each WebSource's "input" and "output" ports

svg.text:
This model illustrates the implementation of a room model whose icon color changes as a function of the room temperature, and of a proportional controller.
Input to the room model is the control signal u_k. Output of the room model is the new room temperature T_{k+1}.
The room model and the control action is computed in Ptolemy II.
Time is in minutes and the simulation runs for two virtual days.
To see the implementation of the room temperature visualization, right-click on the room model, and then select "Open Actor." Then you will see the assignment of a variable "TRoom". Next, close the room model, right-click on the room model and select "Appearance -> Edit Custom Icon". Double-clicking on the colored rectangle shows how the variable "TRoom" is used to assign the color.

property.name: text
property.value: Note: For SDF director, period was originally timestep not 0

property.name: text
property.value:
The SequencePlotter has an HTMLImage attribute This exports the graph to the web page returned by the HttpService
Double-click on SequencePlotter, then click "Configure" next to HTMLImage
The textPosition "graph" instructs the exporter to place the content as a child of the element with id "graph"

entity.name: Ramp
entity.doc: Create a sequence of tokens with increasing value
